Peter Gabriel @itspetergabriel · Nov 28, 2020
"I was shocked and very sorry to learn that Gustavo lost his sight as a result of the violence against the demonstrators in Santiago. It is outrageous and should never be allowed to happen. I hope those responsible face justice.” - pg
@amnesty @AmnestyUK https://www.amnesty.org.uk/write-for-rights/action/Gustavo
Amnesty International @amnesty · Nov 28, 2020
21-year-old Gustavo was blinded by police during a protest in Santiago, Chile in 2019. Gustavo hopes that his blindness will help the world see what is happening in Chile; “I gave my eyes so people would wake up.”

Demand justice for Gustavo: http://amn.st/6018HyhbO #W4R20 📢✍️

To keep supporting musicians during the Covid-19 pandemic, we are waiving our revenue share on all sales this Friday, May 1, from midnight to midnight PDT. Let’s come together as a community to put money directly into artists' pockets: https://daily.bandcamp.com/features/bandcamp-covid-19-fundraiser

Peter Gabriel @itspetergabriel · Feb 12, 2020
Joseph Shabalala had one of the great African voices. His compassionate and gentle singing set the tone for so much of Ladysmith's catalogue of beautiful songs. Full of grace and empathy, just like the man himself. - pg
WOMAD UK @WOMADfestival · Feb 12, 2020
We are deeply saddened to hear of the death of Joseph Shabalala, founder of Ladysmith Black Mambazo. He was a pioneer of South African music and leaves behind an extraordinary legacy.

https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/11/arts/music/joseph-shabalala-dead.html
